column2: WORK SUMMARY:   Perform a wide variety of tasks associated with Servicing, Repairing & Installation and Commissioning of Precise CNC Machine Tools. Use precision test equipment to analyse, troubleshoot and repair complex Electrical problems. Successfully coordinate and complete the installation of various machine tools. Work closely with customers, vendors, and DANOBAT GROUP Team. Independently organize and complete a successful Installation & Service call. Assist other service engineers, and preventive maintenance technicians.    JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:     Dismantle and prepare machines for Installation. Carry out machine geometry and alignment. (Electrical) of the Machines. Assess hardware and software malfunctions by means of diagnostic tools and customer input Ability to perform the trouble shoot online & offline.  Troubleshoot and repair of major machine tool problems. Prepare technical reports including machine assessments. Disassemble, and reassemble machines to repair or replace worn or malfunctioning components and consumables. Maintain parts inventory, personal library of machine manuals, company-assigned tools. Perform routine preventive maintenance and Health Check-ups on CNC machines. Responsible for troubleshooting of PLCs hardware like I/O Modules and other hardware-related issues. Also installing and terminating Electrical Panels according to Drawings Document all service activities and provide detailed reports to management. Coordinate with the sales team to identify potential service opportunities. Report activities and expenses timely and accurately. Communicate with DANOBAT GROUP Service Team & Take Guidance and Instructions  Work with very limited supervision and complete any other duties as assigned. Focus on continuous improvements with respect to service, installation, assembly, problem resolving, and phone support to customers.     JOB REQUIREMENTS :  Advanced machine tool knowledge and terminology.  Degree in Electrical engineering with 8 to12 years of experience in machine tool service.  Complete knowledge of parametric programming ,ladder logic. control motors & drives. Promote spares & consumables to all the existing customers. Promote value-added services like Follow-on-Contract (FOC), Preventive Maintenance Contract (PMC), and health checks. Full understanding and Hands on wiring Internal & External (SMPS, MCB, MCCB, relays, timer). Complete knowledge of PLC, SCADA, HMI, Drives. Mainly with SIEMNES, FANUC & HEIDENHAIN Controls  Advanced troubleshooting abilities. & In-depth understanding of CNC controls Like Siemens and various functions.  Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively. Job requires extensive Travels and at Short Notices  Fluent in English with Spoken and Writing ability. Skills to train Operators and excellent communication Skills with Customers at all levels

column2: Job Description:   As a Junior Service Engineer in the Closed File Review team, your main responsibility is to ensure that closed motor claim files meet our company?? standards and regulatory requirements. Here?? what you??l be doing:   ?     File Review:  You??l thoroughly examine closed motor claim files to make sure they are accurate, complete, and comply with company policies and regulations.   Documentation Verification:  Your job includes carefully checking all claim documents, such as incident reports, estimates, invoices, and settlement agreements, to ensure they are consistent and error-free.   Compliance Assurance:  You??l make sure that all claim handling processes follow legal and regulatory requirements, including insurance laws, industry regulations, and company guidelines.   Data Analysis:  You??l analyse claim data and trends to identify areas where we can improve our processes and reduce risks.   Quality Assurance:  Maintaining high-quality standards is crucial. You??l identify any errors or areas for improvement and provide feedback to the team.   Communication:  You??l work closely with surveyors, claim processors, and other internal stakeholders to address questions, resolve issues, and ensure that review observations are closed effectively.   Reporting:  You??l prepare regular reports summarizing your findings from file reviews, highlighting any concerns, trends, and recommendations for improvement.   Training and Development:  You??l help develop and deliver training programs to enhance the skills and knowledge of our claim?? handlers, focusing on file documentation, compliance requirements, and best practices.   Continuous Improvement:  You??l actively participate in departmental meetings and projects aimed at making our operations more efficient, improving customer satisfaction, and enhancing overall performance.      Roles and Responsibilities   We??e looking for candidates who have:     A Diploma/B. Tech/BE or higher qualification in Mechanical/Automobile Engineering   0-1 years of experience in handling motor claims adjudication in an insurance company or supervising an automobile body shop   Excellent English writing and speaking skills to effectively communicate complex information to technical and non-technical audiences.   Experience in writing reports, briefs, and critical emails.   Knowledge of insurance and understanding of IRDA guidelines and compliance are desirable.

column2: Company Description   My Placement Management Consultants is a traditional recruiting team that has created a network of highly skilled workforce for the Mining & Machinery industries. Our management team includes experts who deliver exceptional results in technical staff augmentation, professional services, and system integration program delivery. We focus on providing the best resources for current positions in Heavy earth moving equipment, Mining, Machinery, and Engineering in HEMM & Mining industries. column2: Under the direction of the Field Service Manager the Field Service Engineer provides after sales service.          Supervises the installation, commissioning, overhaul and troubleshooting of Elliott and other OEM equipment at customers sites, on his own, or under the direction of a Project Manager or Senior Service Engineer.          Assures that work is carried out in accordance with the customers expectations or specifications while ensuring that safety, environmental and quality policies are adhered to.          Produces service income for Elliott Company.          Requires a bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering plus five to ten years of experience in the field of turbomachinery; or equivalent combination of education and experience.          Strong mechanical, thermodynamical aptitude for rotating machinery, as well as commercial aptitude.          Ability to read and understand drawings, technical documentation, blueprints, layouts and schedules.          Ability to write technical documents.          Knowledge of electrical and digital systems.          Flexible so can cope with wide variety of problems, customers and site conditions.          Must be willing to work in camps, on platforms and in non-industrialized countries. Tropical fitness is a must.          Good communication skills. Profound knowledge of the English language, verbal and written.          Computer skills - Microsoft Word, Excel, Projects, Lotus Notes.          Advanced Supervisory Skills.          Ability to lead discussions in training classes and meetings.          Must be capable of representing Elliott Company in a positive manner.          Must be capable of calming difficult situations.                  Principal activities of this job are analyzing customer s problems, collecting and recording product and technical information, to summarize findings, to report product troubles as well as contractual troubles on each assignment. Further, to direct the      assigned labor force, which may be Elliotts own labor, customer supplied or contracted and to ensure that equipment is built to the required standards and procedures relating to installation, commissioning, start-up, repair or maintenance work of customers equipment.          Although some activities are covered by policy, precedent, or standard procedures, most of      the work has to be programmed and supervised by the service engineer based on actual site requirements.          As Elliott seldom builds two machines alike or customers seldom use an Elliott machine in identical service, the likelihood of responding to new or unfamiliar situations is a very real and common occurrence.          Advises customer on operating and maintenance procedures, recommends proper parts stocking and overhaul programs to minimize equipment downtime.          Assists in performance testing/evaluation.                  Internal contacts:           All levels of management and assigned employees in the following departments: Field Service Operations, Repair Shop Operations, Service Parts Operations, Technical Service, Rerates and Modifications, Aftermarket Sales, Finance/Accounting, Legal/Contract Administration, HSE.            External contacts:           Customers, Vendors, Sub-contractors, Sales Representatives/Agents.          Internal and external ISO & HSE auditors.          Acts mostly as sole company representative while at site.            Regional Section (in addition to above):             Travel requirements expected to be 100%, if not stated differently in the employment letter.          This position is primarily one of individual contribution. However, the Engineer may supervise customer personnel (for new equipment installations rather in an advisory than in a direct supervisory capacity), and may also supervise service representatives, hired labor and local contractors.          Ensures all work is performed in a safe manner to prevent injury to personnel or equipment, ie ensures that safety, quality and schedule are obtained.          Adheres to instructions and guidelines as described in the quality and HSE management systems.          Can be asked to assist in the quotation process for minor projects.          Handles and coordinates technical issues of a project, such as installation, commissioning, trouble shooting or maintenance.          Schedules and allocates personnel and material to execute work scopes, plans and prepares minor projects.

column1: Field Service Expert Center Engineer III
column2: An Expert Centre Specialist or ECS will act as a liaison, provide product/services information, and resolve any emerging problems that our customers might face; they embody the Waters corporate identity in appearance, demeanor, values and ethics      Expert Centre specialists are    key organizational people    who help our customers in resolving any issues as quickly and efficiently as possible      They have a strong positive influence on our internal and external customers and provide an exceptional customer experience to them at every touch point      Specifically, to our external customers they deliver fast solutions even to complicated problems and in many cases with their strong ability and capabilities without dispatching an engineer to site      Internally the role has a knowledge sharing scope to influence and motivate teams of engineers in delivering world class service to our customers          Field-based support teams will revert to our Expert Centre colleagues in difficult Technical situations (product escalations) who in turn will liaise with multiple stakeholders within the Waters organization to ensure customer and staff success      The Expert Centre function and its people s goal is to ensure excellent service standards, respond efficiently to direct and indirect customer inquiries and maintain the highest levels of customer relationships and satisfaction leading to an overall differentiated Customer Experience              What does the Expert Centre Professional do? / Who are the Expert Centre Specialist?                The best ECS s are genuinely excited to help Waters customers.          They re patient, empathetic, and passionately communicative; they love to talk and can put themselves in their customers shoes and advocate for them when necessary.          Customer feedback is priceless, and these ECS s can gather that.          Problem-solving also comes naturally.          They are confident at troubleshooting and further investigation even if they don t have enough information to resolve customer complaints.        Responsibilities                  Manage incoming Web Requests for technical queries.              Manage the customer journey from the logging of a corrective call to successful completion, setting expectations and delivering an exceptional customer experience throughout              Work in partnership with Waters field service engineers and Waters support teams to quickly resolve customer issues and maximize customer satisfaction.          Quick and effective resolution of customers queries resolving the maximum possible number of customer issues remotely.          Actively participate in Waters Internal Escalation calls and meetings, keeping customers well informed of progress.          Utilize, promote and contribute to Waters tools, such a Waters Knowledge Base and How to Video s .          Provide customers with high quality technical advice and direction, working closely and acting as a point person with Waters Global Service Support [GSS].          Practice commercial awareness to position billable and plan solutions to our customer to drive their success.          Carry out site work such as PM visits installations, support and product training sessions to maintain Skill Sets.          Maintain Customer call tracking database in accordance with Company Policy.          Drive internal and Customer KPIs to best in class standard.          Approximately 80% of time on Expert Centre activities remaining 20% on customer sites delivering services.              Qualifications        Successful candidate is likely to have the following competencies:            Education to a minimum of Degree level in Chemistry / Biochemistry / Electronics          Experience with U/HPLC & MS instrumentation and Laboratory Data Systems (3 years)          Knowledge of HPLC & MS qualification procedures          Good communication skills both written and verbal, and enjoy personal interaction and relationship building          Calm under pressure and the ability to prioritize workload          Impeccable customer skills with a high level of attentiveness and empathy          Highly organized with good time management skills and a can-do attitude          Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think innovatively and outside the box          An ability to negotiate both internally and externally with various stakeholders including customers          An accomplished Team Player, who enjoys working closely with diverse personalities and cross functional groups across a variety of cultures          Desire to expand knowledge, learn, grow and develop in a fast-moving business environment          An early adopter and someone who embraces and advocates new technologies          Willingness to travel up to 25% of the time.

column2: Role & responsibilities     The air-conditioning technicians install, inspect, maintain, and repair air conditioner. They ventilate equipment and controls making sure they operate efficiently and continuously. They perform regular maintenance work on cooling units. They diagnose electrical and mechanical defects and malfunctions. They install, replace, or repair equipment that has been damaged. They make adjustment and do calibrations of thermostatic controls. They install new air-conditioning systems and equipment. They inspect and maintain refrigerators and ice machines, and chilled water supply systems. They clean blowers and coils, check tensions of belts and motors. They make plans and designs of new air-conditioning systems including their installation and maintenance. Installing, maintaining and repairing ventilation and air conditioning systems and equipment. Identifying maintenance risks on equipment. Diagnosing electrical and mechanical faults for HVAC systems. Cleaning, adjusting and repairing systems, and performing warranty services. Performing emergency repairs promptly and efficiently. Providing technical direction and on-the-job training. Keeping daily logs and records of all maintenance functions. Ensuring compliance with appliance standards and with Occupational Health and Safety Act. Complying with service standards, work instructions and customers' requirements. Assisting with customers' queries. Analyzes blue prints, schematics, and drawings for the purpose of identifying the location of new and existing HVAC systems and determining the efficient installation of additional systems.  Cleans air conditioning and heating units (e.g. coils, condensation pans, drain lines, cooling towers, etc.) for the purpose of ensuring units are operating efficiently, correctly and within safety guidelines.  Coordinates with supervisor and other trades (e.g. inspectors, suppliers, contractors, district personnel, consultants, etc.) for the purpose of completing projects and work orders.  Diagnoses causes of problems and/or failures in HVAC systems and energy management control systems for the purpose of identifying equipment and/or systems repair and/or replacement needs ensuring responsive and corrective action for urgent building operation items, indoor air quality, thermal comfort parameters.  Estimates labor, materials, and/or equipment needed to complete work projects for the purpose of ensuring timely completion of projects.  Fabricates or coordinates the fabrication of equipment parts for the purpose of meeting specialty needs and/or replacing unavailable parts.  Informs personnel regarding procedures and/or status of work orders for the purpose of providing information for making decisions, taking appropriate action and/or complying with building and safety regulations.  Installs HVAC equipment and systems (e.g. actuators, compressors, building control systems, DDC sensors, heat pumps, alarm systems, control panels, energy management control systems, pressure reducing valves, etc.) for the purpose of providing enhanced and/or upgraded capabilities.  Maintains clean and orderly conditions in all working areas for the purpose of observing all safety practices and regulations. Maintains records (e.g. equipment repair history, work orders, test reports, etc.) for the purpose of documenting required information.  Maintains vehicle, tools and equipment for the purpose of ensuring availability in safe operating condition. Monitors contract work for the purpose of ensuring contract terms are fulfilled and work standards are met. Monitors HVAC systems and their components (e.g. heating units, building exhaust fans, ventilation units, etc.) for the purpose of evaluating condition, identifying necessary repairs and recommending preventive and predictive maintenance.  Performs emergence, predictive and preventive maintenance for the purpose of ensuring the ongoing functioning of HVAC systems. Prepares written materials (e.g. repair status, activity logs, recommendations, etc.) for the purpose of documenting activities and/or conveying information.  Prioritizes work orders for the purpose of addressing health and safety problems first.  Responds to emergency situations during or after hours for the purpose of resolving immediate safety concerns. Secures equipment and supplies (e.g. locates parts, makes purchases, etc.) for the purpose of maintaining inventory and ensuring availability of items required to complete the necessary installation and/or repair. Transports a variety of tools, equipment and supplies for the purpose of ensuring the availability of materials required at job site. Desired Candidate Profile: Should have good Technical Skill. Should have strong exp in servicing. Your understanding to our position is as follows:

column2: Qualifications Requirements        The Service Engineer (SE) will be responsible for meeting the daily service maintenance and repair needs of the customer s equipment. Essential Job Responsibilities        The SE performs the major functions listed below. The position may require additional duties/responsibilities that may not be outlined below, and specific functions are subject to change.        Basic troubleshooting, installation, maintenance and repair on designated equipment. Completing Preventative Maintenance and field modifications.          Ordering and managing repair parts cycle times.          Keeping up to date on administrative responsibilities such as maintaining customer service logs and internal service records in a timely manner.          Maintaining daily communications with customers to ensure resolution and proper follow-up. Maintaining tools and test equipment and ensuring they are properly calibrated. Utilizing the escalation process to resolve customer service delivery issues.          Identifying and participating in sales opportunities such as new contracts, contract renewals and system sales.          Working as a member of the local team to provide efficient service delivery to all accounts within assigned area.          The ability to lift and carry a toolbox that can weigh up to 50 lbs.        The following qualifications are the minimum requirements necessary to successfully perform this role. However, any equivalent combination of experience, education and training, which provides the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities, would be acceptable, subject to any legal and/or regulatory requirements.        Bachelor s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or any other relevant field where he/she is working in. A technical training or an associate degree would be preferred. Previous experience in the service industry would also be beneficial.          Valid driver s license is required.          Proficient level of computer skills including MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook. Excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical issues in an easy-to-understand manner.          Ability to work in a fast-paced, self-directed, entrepreneurial environment.          Resourceful, with the ability to work independently.          Strong time management skills.          Ability to adapt to changing circumstances.          Decision-making, problem resolution and creative thinking skills          Attention to detail. column2: The person in this position has front-line responsibility for installations, remote and on-site diagnostics prior to repair services as well as preventive maintenance visits on Accuray systems, primarily to Accuray customers located regionally but occasionally throughout all EIMEA Region.     The successful candidate must have proven ability to diagnose and resolve problems on highly sophisticated software, electronic and mechanical robotic devices at clinical sites and major hospitals. Applicants must have the ability to work independently and have effective communication skills.     Field Service engineers may also work hours other than a traditional daytime shift and may also work weekend days as part of their normal workdays with limited notice due to the emergent nature of service work. Regular work schedules are determined by a combination of Accuray s service obligations and customer service needs and are subject to change as needs arise             REPORTING TO/DEPARTMENT:            Deputy Service Manager India           ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:              PRODUCT SUPPORT          Provide installation, repair and maintenance support to Accuray systems.     Support is provided to the customer remotely by phone, internet and by on-site visits, as determined by the machine status or customer requirements.     Promoting the highest level of customer satisfaction through the timely response to customer calls, clear and effective communications, professional appearance, and efficient repair/maintenance activities.     Self-management of schedule and work priorities to ensure that urgent customer requirements are addressed timely and customer satisfaction is optimized.     Accurate and clear documentation of work activities are to be completed within the Accuray Customer Management software program, such that these records provide appropriate documentation of the product service history for Device History File records.     Appropriate care of parts inventory and prompt return of replaced parts that are required to be returned to the Accuray stock for processing.     Appropriate management and timely completion of Timesheets and expense reports incurred in the field service of Accuray systems.     Assist in the development of service documentation, in conjunction with the Accuray Customer Service team.     Assist in the training of further Customer Support staff and customer on site personnel with respect to maintenance and service activities, as required.     Assist in identification and development of Field Support tools and test equipment.     Follow Company training as needed. (e.g., basic technical training of 6 weeks at Accuray Headquarters in the US).     Learn and apply all Accuray internal policies and processes.     Follow local regulations (such as radioprotection rules - attends and runs TUV Audits at customer).             PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT          Provides feedback through the Madison Customer Service group for service-related product improvements that could improve Mean Time to Access (MTTA) and Mean Time to Repair (MTTR), or improvements in mean Time Between Failures (MTBF).     Assist in the development, documentation, and testing of service tools and design updates to the product.     Works effectively with other engineers, scientists, subcontractors, and consultants.     Support project team activities, with attendance at team meetings, representation of Field Service requirements, and provision of documentation as required.             SAFETY          Observe Accuray Safety Program requirements and work practices.     Help ensure that safety requirements and quality considerations are pro-actively addressed and implemented in the design of the product.     Communicate to the Accuray corporate, or where possible directly address, quality issues raised by customers, in a timely fashion.     Supports the Accuray Quality System and Safety and Health Program by following procedures and mentoring others.     Takes ownership of individual safety to maintain a safe work environment.             The incumbent may be asked to perform other function-related activities in addition to the above-mentioned responsibilities as reasonably required by business needs.             REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:         Minimum 3 years experience in field service, installation, and troubleshooting complex electronic equipment or bachelor s degree in with less field experience considered. A basic understanding of medical physics is desirable.     Previous experience in large medical device field service strongly preferred.     Be a self-starter and work without close supervision, be able to successfully schedule, organize and conduct field service activities in assigned territory     Hands-on experience with electronic test equipment.     Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.     Good H/W and S/W computer skills, including network knowledge. Ability to quickly learn to use new software tools.     Excellent customer relations skills and strong service orientation.     Team player - ability to work well in a close team environment.     Fluent reading, writing and speaking in local language and English.     Must be comfortable with extensive travel (up to 50% travel time), sometimes on short notice, and occasional after-hours support requirements.

column1: Electrical Panel Service And Commissioning Engineer
column2: About Us:  Irya SmarTec is where we redefine excellence in electrical services. Our journey is powered by a team of industry experts, armed with profound knowledge and a proven track record in successfully executing a wide array of electrical projects. Irya SmarTec stands at the forefront of innovation, boasting seasoned, certified technicians, and a steadfast commitment to delivering quality workmanship.  www.irya.co.in Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Testing and Troubleshooting Service Engineer specializing in Electrical Panels to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for conducting testing, commissioning, and troubleshooting of electrical panels and associated systems. This role requires a strong technical background in electrical engineering, excellent problem-solving abilities, and a customer-centric approach to service delivery. As a Testing and Troubleshooting Service Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the reliability, performance, and safety of electrical panels for our clients. Responsibilities: Testing and Commissioning: Perform comprehensive testing and commissioning of electrical panels, including switchgear, distribution boards, control panels, and associated components. Conduct functional tests, insulation resistance tests, continuity tests, and performance tests to ensure compliance with specifications and standards. Generate detailed test reports and documentation, including as-built drawings, test procedures, and equipment records. Troubleshooting and Diagnostics: Identify and diagnose electrical faults, malfunctions, and performance issues in panels and control systems. Utilize diagnostic tools, schematics, and technical manuals to isolate problems and implement effective solutions. Collaborate with engineering and maintenance teams to develop troubleshooting strategies and preventive maintenance plans. Repairs and Maintenance: Perform repairs, adjustments, and component replacements to rectify electrical faults and restore functionality. Conduct preventive maintenance activities, including cleaning, lubrication, and calibration of equipment, to prolong equipment lifespan and prevent downtime. Provide recommendations for equipment upgrades, modifications, or enhancements to improve reliability and performance. Customer Support: Interface directly with clients to understand their requirements, address concerns, and provide technical assistance and support. Respond promptly to service requests, prioritize tasks, and manage workload effectively to meet customer expectations and deadlines. Communicate professionally and courteously with clients, maintaining a positive and collaborative relationship throughout the service process. Quality Assurance and Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant safety standards, codes, and regulations governing electrical installations and equipment. Conduct quality inspections and audits to verify adherence to quality standards and specifications. Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service delivery processes and procedures. Requirements: Bachelors degree/Diploma in electrical engineering or related field. 4-8 years of experience in testing, troubleshooting, and servicing electrical panels and control systems is a must Candidates who have work experience in Bangalore would be prefered. Strong knowledge of electrical principles, components, and systems, with a focus on panels and switchgear. Proficiency in diagnostic tools, testing equipment, and software applications used in electrical testing and troubleshooting. Familiarity with relevant industry standards and regulations (e.g., NEC, IEEE, NEMA). Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Knowledge of local language is a must Willingness to travel to client sites and work flexible hours as needed.

column2: Company Overview: Oben Electric,  a trailblazing electric motorcycle manufacturer, was established in August 2020 by visionary alumni from prestigious institutions like IIT and IIM. Headquartered in Bengaluru, we are driven by relentless innovation and a commitment to excellence towards 'Design in India for the World'. With a robust R&D infrastructure, we design, develop, and manufacture electric motorcycles and critical EV components in-house, holding over 25+ patents for our proprietary technology. Oben Electric is driving the widespread adoption of electric motorcycles across India and beyond. Join us in shaping the future of mobility and be a part of our journey towards sustainable transportation solutions. Website: www.obenelectric.com Position:  Service Engineer (EV 2- wheeler) Locations:  Bangalore   ( 314-319, Jigani Bommasandra Link Rd, Anekal Taluk Jigani, Bengaluru-560105 ) Job Description: 1)Responsible for setting up spare parts function in Oben. 2)Responsible for day-today operations of spare parts (purchase order/ invoicing/ eway bill handling) 3)Maintaining physical stock of spare parts and managing spare parts warehouse. Maintain 5S and FIFO. 4)MIS for confirming next 3 months demand forecast vs actual spare parts/ consumption pattern/ dealer wise stock situation monitoring. 5)Training to dealer staff for workshop/ service center operations (spare parts & other operations) 6)Warranty parts management and MIS Educational Qualification: Graduate engineering is MUST in Mechanical/ Electrical/ Electronics MBA will be preferred. Experience: Min. 5 years of total work experience Few years working in OEM (ICE) EV experience will be preferred. Language: Hindi/ English mandatory Local Language preferred. Skills: Fault diagnosis/ root cause analysis/ problem solving ability. Knowledge of GST/ invoicing and other commercial know-how MS-office (proficient in excel/ PowerPoint) SAP system knowledge will be preferred.

column2: Installation & Commissioning:       Understanding the specification and completing the installation & Commissioning site activities according to the contractual requirement & time schedule. On Site Service: Ensure availability of necessary material, equipment & manpower at site by coordinating with the respective stakeholders.     Manage site activities as per the time schedule until completion of the project and inform Field service project Manager or service manager for assistance required for additional resources / material.     The GIS-Supervisor is responsible for the installation work entrusted to him being carried in perfect technical order. He carries out installation and maintenance work independently. He instructs, supervises, and controls the installation personnel reporting to him at site. He is responsible for ensuring compliance with the installation requirements and instructions. He ensures necessary accident prevention measures are observed; specifically, he abides by the guidelines for work on live system components. He supervises the adherence to the working hours, signs the mom, weekly reports & timesheets and is responsible for forwarding these on.     The GIS Supervisor ensures that the stipulated deadlines are met, i.e., he is responsible for detailed installation planning on-site to enable bottlenecks to be identified in good time, to formulate proposals for achieving targets and implementing appropriate measures. Testing: Perform testing for Installed & Commissioned products and provide input to the design team for any modification. Quality Control: Verifies the application of quality control plan during installation activities and that the sub contractors are using the safety equipments as per the requirement.     Documentation: Coordinates with the customer on documentation required and safety coordination. Information: Inform respective stakeholders on the progress of Installation & Commissioning activities and provide input to the quality team for any non conformance.             Qualification & Experience:        Diploma (Mechanical / Electrical):     5 - 7 Years experience. OR BE (Mechanical / Electrical): 3 - 4 Years experience.
column11: GIS, Supervisor, SUB, Compliance, Mechanical, MOM, Manager Quality Control, Management, Electricals, Testing

column2: We are seeking a Senior Service Engineer to join our dynamic team and ensure the seamless installation, maintenance, and commissioning of our printing equipment.               ?       Job Description:       ?     The Senior Service Engineer will play a crucial role in providing technical   support for the installation, maintenance, and commissioning of screen and digital printers used in textile printing applications. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the optimal performance of our printing equipment at customer sites and will work closely with our clients to address any technical issues that may arise.               ?       Key responsibilities include:         Installation and Commissioning:         Lead the installation and commissioning of screen and digital printers at customer sites.     Conduct thorough inspections to ensure that all equipment is installed correctly and functioning according to specifications.     Collaborate with customers to customize printer settings based on their specific requirements.             Maintenance and Repairs:         Perform routine maintenance checks on printing equipment to identify and address any potential issues proactively.     Diagnose and troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, and software-related problems.     Coordinate with internal teams to order replacement parts and components as needed.     Execute timely repairs to minimize downtime and ensure uninterrupted production.             Customer Support:         Serve as the primary point of contact for technical support inquiries from customers.     Provide comprehensive training to customer personnel on the operation and maintenance of printing equipment.     Offer remote assistance and on-site support to resolve technical issues promptly.             Travel and Flexibility:         Be willing to travel extensively to customer sites for installation, maintenance, and support purposes.     Adapt to varying work schedules and locations based on customer demands.     Maintain flexibility to accommodate urgent service requests and tight deadlines.             Adherence to Protocols:           Follow established service protocols and procedures to ensure consistency and quality in all service activities.     Adhere to safety guidelines and regulations while working on customer premises.     Document service interventions, including detailed reports and service logs.             Qualifications:         bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.     Proven experience (7 to 10 years) working with large format industrial printers, preferably in the textile industry. column2: Are you passionate about coffee? Do you possess exceptional technical skills? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and love troubleshooting and fixing complex machinery? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to become an integral part of our team as a Coffee Machine Field Service Technician. Location: Multiple roles available. Field-based - Mumbai, Bangalore, Delhi, Hyderabad Responsibilities: As a Coffee Machine Field Service Technician, you will be the technical expert on the front line, ensuring our customers enjoy uninterrupted coffee experiences. Your responsibilities will include: Expert Equipment Repairs: Diagnosing and repairing coffee machines at customer locations, ensuring minimal downtime and maximum satisfaction, ranging from thorough fault finding to accurate diagnosis. Ensure all coffee equipment is left in excellent working order, maintaining high-quality standards. Efficient Site Surveys and Installations: Conduct site surveys and equipment installations, ensuring seamless operations and functionality. Timely Filter Exchanges: Promptly carry out filter exchanges as needed or directed, contributing to the smooth operation of the coffee equipment. Consistent Coffee Quality: Ensure that all work aligns with the agreed equipment specifications, resulting in consistent coffee quality.??Promote first-time fixes leading to customer satisfaction. Proactive Communication: Collaborate proactively with your line manager, seeking day-to-day instructions and providing regular updates on workload to ensure customers are kept informed about the progress of their service. Adherence to Arrival Procedures: Comply with all on-site arrival procedures, contacting a Manager/Supervisor on-site to introduce yourself and seek permission before commencing any work on the equipment. Safety and Risk Management: Prioritise safety and adhere to Health and Safety procedures. Conduct thorough risk assessments to ensure a safe working environment and promptly inform the company management of any identified risks. Thorough Documentation: Complete all necessary online job sheets, time sheets, and supporting documentation in a timely manner before leaving the premises. This ensures accurate record-keeping and validates client satisfaction. Care of Tools and Vehicles: Maintain all tools, equipment, and vehicles provided by the company in good working order. Report any faults, breakages, or equipment failures to your line manager daily for prompt resolution. Customer Training: Educate customers on machine operation, maintenance, and best practices, empowering them to enjoy the perfect cup of coffee every time. Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with our engineering and product teams to share insights from the field, contributing to the constant improvement of our coffee machines. Qualifications: Technical Aptitude: A strong foundation in mechanical and electrical systems, with the ability to diagnose and repair technical issues effectively. Experience: Previous experience in coffee machine repair or a similar field. Customer Focus: A customer-centric mindset with excellent communication skills to interact with customers and address their needs professionally. Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to think on your feet and find innovative solutions to technical challenges. Coffee Passion: An unyielding passion for coffee, its origins, and the art of brewing the perfect cup. Time Management: Strong organisational skills to manage your schedule efficiently and ensure timely response to customer requests. Team Player: A collaborative attitude, willing to work closely with our team to achieve our common goals. Full clean driving license: This is a field-based role so you will need to travel daily to customer locations, plus occasional travel to company meetings. Computer literate: Ability to complete all relevant paperwork and documentation. Flexible approach: Self-motivated with a flexible approach to work, location and hours.

column2: On Highway Field Service engineer Description Acts as the technical specialist and primary customer support contact to independently diagnose and complete repairs to products at a single customer site Independently performs diagnostics and completes repairs on equipment at customer site Maintains productive customer relations and ensures prompt and efficient attention to customer needs to minimize customer product downtime Coaches on preventative maintenance and/or repairs completed by more experienced technicians and/or customer technicians; may provide work direction to others; may review repair plans, parts and tool lists, etc Manages parts and spares inventory at the work site Escalates unresolved issues to product specialists / Supervisor Completes required documentation, such as service worksheets, timesheets, warranty claims, quality documents via handwritten forms or business system input screens. Identifies additional sales and service opportunities with customer Completes training in line with skill and business requirements Maintains work area and tools for cleanliness and proper operation Ensure adherence to all relevant Health Safety &Environmental policies, procedures and legislation and reports any issues / incidents to site management and to their supervisor. Skills Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. Manages complexity - Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. Manages conflict - Handling conflict situations effectively, with a minimum of noise. Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions. Develops talent - Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organization??s goals. Self-development - Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels. Service Documentation - Creates and verifies customer, equipment and technical information; captures specific data using required service tools; follows procedures and documents required information in the service management system in order to have an accurate record of the work done. Technical Escalation - Obtains product technical issue information and utilizes available resources including data management tools; elevates issues to a higher level of expertise, balancing timeliness of customer response with investigation efforts; captures all troubleshooting steps in the appropriate database in order to ensure seamless transitions and accurate response to ticket resolution in a timely manner. Diagnostics Application - Translates customer complaints to develop troubleshooting plan; troubleshoots issue following guided work flows, procedures, specialized equipment such as mechanical and electronic service tools, and diagnoses computer software to isolate failed components to enable a successful repair; validates repair by duplicating complaint to ensure it has been resolved; documents results of troubleshooting in business systems to communicate what has been done for payment and historical tracking. Electronic Service Tool Application - Identifies the suite of available hardware and software tools required for a service event; utilizes the appropriate electronic tool set to maintain the product or diagnose and troubleshoot an issue; interprets electronic tool results or recommendations to determine next steps for service resolution. Product Repair and Maintenance - Repairs and maintains mechanical/electrical products following guidelines, using required tools within standard repair time to ensure a quality repair; disassembles and assembles engines or power generators following guidelines, using required tools to ensure a clean and organized environment; inspects and replaces parts and components following re-use guidelines to minimize customers cost of ownership; performs progressive damage check following guidelines to restore to pre-failure condition. Engine Systems Interactions - Interprets and analyzes the interactions of internal and external electrical and mechanical systems (exhaust, heating, cooling, fuel systems, driveline, aftertreatment, controls, sensors, etc.) by applying tools, service publications (Cummins, Original Equipment Manufacturer) and taking measurements to efficiently and correctly diagnose and repair. Health and Safety Fundamentals - Champions and models proactive health and safety behaviors by identifying, reporting and participating in actions to improve health and safety in order to build an interdependent culture and contribute to an injury-free workplace. Education, Licenses, Certifications Apprentice Certified Power Generation and/or Engine Technician Vocational diploma from relevant technical institution (Preferred) Current relevant electrical certification (optional) Locally valid driving permit This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations. Experience Significant field service work experience Extensive knowledge of power generation and/or engine products Basic understanding of competitors and typical industry practices High Voltage/ Low Voltage practical experience (optional) ON Highway TML Channel & CCC handling is proffered

column2: Family Description       Customer Services (CS) covers customer service in different areas such as technical support, account support, operations, maintenance, network design / deployment / integration / transformation, and education. Generates revenue and the increase of customer satisfaction through planning, designing, deploying, integrating, optimising, operating, and maintaining phases.       Subfamily Description       Managed Services (MSE) is responsible for keeping the network running and proposing / conducting network upgrades based on business requirements. Covers technical managing and operating of agreed components of IT and telecommunications services provided to end users of Nokia customers, within contracts agreed with those customers.           Impact       Impact is short-term and departmental/project in scope. Accountable for quality, accuracy and efficiency. Actions and errors can have functional area impact.        Scope Contribution       Individual Contributor: Variety of complex tasks within area of responsibility, Demonstrates initiative contributes to problem solving. Acts with independence and discretion in routine matters. Makes decisions that affect own work. Managerial/Supervisory: May act as Team Leader or Project Leader with some direct supervisory responsibilities in addition to own work assignments. Variety of complex tasks within area of responsibility. Acts with independence and discretion in routine matters. Makes decisions that affect own work.       Innovation       Performs routine activites to meet departmental/project objectives. Requires moderate supervision. Applies commonly recognised concepts within their field of expertise. Shares knowledge with less experienced peers or have high collegial interaction. Raises innovative ideas. Demonstrates adaptability to changing business environments. Is willing to take on new roles or jobs appropriate to skill set in different environments and/or locations.        Communication       Works to influence others to accept job functions view/practices and agree/accept new concepts, practices, and approaches. May conduct briefings with senior leaders within the job function. May at times be required to negotiate regarding operational issues. Has cross-cultural knowledge and global mindset       Knowledge Experience       Established skills and knowledge of theory and principles within a professional discipline. Uses functionally specific knowledge.Typically 5-8 years directly related experience and a graduate equivalent degree.         Incident Manager role is responsible and accountable for overall end to end governance of all P1 P2 Incidents being reported from the network. This role is also end-to-end owner of Crisis Management, Escalation management, Bridge management, Executive Communication management, Critical Key SLA management, Emergency Change coordination, Vendor management, Post Incident Report Management, Floor Management and Outage Handling support.           To own and meet the target of Critical SLAs every month     To govern outages end-to-end and restore the Impact/services within SLA     To govern and manage the vendors/third parties on all outages     To be accountable for all the communications during outages that goes in paging to Customer and Nokia Management.     To act as a Crisis Manager and plan/do/act on the Crisis with end-to-end view of the network.     To act as single point of contact for Customer/Vendor/Third parties     Management for all issues as second level escalation     To govern and run the technical bridge and management bridges with Nokia, Customer vendors.     To drive the actions derived from the Customer Management bridges.     To prepare the SLA ratification Post incident report of high quality every month for all the reported outages.     To govern and run the incidents that are reported by CTO/GM/Head of ops through periodical bridge.     To review Emergency changes from both technical and service impact point of view and be the Sole Approver of all Emergency changes in the entire network.     To support GDC Management on BCP execution and any other Crisis from GDC.     Proven ability to work with others to meet common objectives and customer expectations.     Able to work in a changing environment and able to adapt with these changes.     Proven excellence in: Planning; Leadership, Communication, Negotiation, Problem Solving and Organizational influence.     Must be able to multitask effectively across other responsibilities.     Highly process-focused and Results/outcome oriented..     Can identify improvement opportunities and implement necessary changes.     Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.     Strong facilitation skills and ability to gain consensus.     Takes initiative to creatively resolve issues and find solutions.     Proven ability to see business processes through a customer lens.     Strong negotiation, conflict resolution, and influencing skills.     Strong analytical skills, comfortable with data and statistics.     Data Driven decision maker and comfortable communicating with all levels within the organization.

Candidate must have command on English & good communication skills.         Candidate must have familiar with latest safety standard.  Candidate must have customer handling as well as manpower/ team handling capabilities.         He will be responsible for safe & successful completion of site work,  communication with factory various departments,  suppliers & customer.         Candidate must have knowledge of General arrangement drawings,  schematic drawings and capable of successful parallel operation & other schemes.         Living Hitachi Energy s core values of safety and integrity,  which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.             Your background:          Candidate should be BE/ B. tech in electrical engineering from reputed college of engineering.         Candidate must have minimum experience of 5 years in power Transformers & Reactors erection,  testing and commissioning,  trouble shooting of power Transformers upto 500 MVA,  765 KV class.         Relevant experience of erection,  testing & commissioning of power Transformers upto 765 KV class.         Proficient in MS-Office,  excel & email.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong problem-solving skills Must have experience of checking schematic wiring,  RTCC panel,  OLTC parallel operation etc.         Oil filling & filtration,  vacuum process at site.  Understanding all types of power transformers & reactors.         Handling turnkey projects,  765 KV class Transformers & reactors,  HVDC transformers etc.         Proficiency in both spoken & written English language is required.

column2: Main activity and purpose of the position "   Senior Service Engineer   " is to provide technical service support to Liebherr customers and machines.                 ?           Role and Responsibilities             Diagnose, adjust, repair or overhaul equipment of Liebherr EMT division such as Wheeled Loaders, Excavators, Dozers etc     Apply electrical, electronically, hydraulically and mechanical theory and related knowledge to test and modify operational electrical machinery and electrical control, electronically control equipment and circuitry, hydraulically circuits and components, mechanical equipment.     Operate machine for test, inspection, diagnoses and trouble shoot.     Test mechanical products and equipment after repair or modification to ensure proper performance and compliance with manufacturer s specifications.     Repair and replace damaged or worn parts with Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) spares and OEM repaired parts.     Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on Liebherr machines.     Examine parts for damage or excessive wear using relevant measuring devices.     Read, understand, and interpret operating manuals, parts manuals, blueprints and technical drawings.     Overhaul and test machines/equipment/components to ensure operating efficiency and safe integrity of the machine.     Oversees the maintenance of quality standards through visual and mechanical inspection methods.     Demonstrate working knowledge of Machine diagnostic Software used on handled machines.     Complete jobs independently with as little assistance from others as possible.     Assist customers with troubleshooting, part and machine related questions when needed.     While assisting customers or during visits to machines inform and ensure customer and their operation and maintenance staff follows the correct maintenance practice. Wherever needed record the incorrect processes and instruct customer to follow the correct practices.     Maintains a minimum set of tools and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) required for job performance.     Cares and maintains company tools, machines and equipment.     Maintains a positive attitude and role model for the other employees to follow.     Maintains company service literature, and maintains a high awareness of technical changes.     Trains and/or mentors others in department.     Complete assigned paperwork as to procedures. As a minimum time sheet, work report, expense report in the latest available version. Fill out all forms properly including customer signature where applicable.     Promotes a safe work environment by following on site safety rules and ensuring the group and self-follow established safety procedures.     Oversees the handling and disposing of hazardous wastes, such as toner, oil, antifreeze, transmission fluid, auto parts cleaner and similar material.     Refuses to carry out unsafe tasks in conflict with Liebherr procedures or technical rules.     Follows the Liebherr code of conduct.     Apart from above carries out any other responsibility assigned by the management from time to time.                 Qualification and Education Requirements             Full time Degree / Diploma in Mechanical / Automobile Engineering from reputed Institute / University.      The successful candidate will possess excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to communicate effectively with personnel at all organizational levels.         Experience         Minimum 7 years of hands on experience on Earth moving and Mining equipment. Preferably on Dozers, Wheeled Loaders, Excavators or similar machines in regards to maintenance.             Preferred Skills / Special Skills         Well conversant with hydraulic, electrical system and engine system.     Demonstrated initiative to visualize, organize, manage, and complete assigned task in individual and group settings.     Self-motivated behaviour (specifically in stressful situations).             Foreign Languages         English fluent in both spoken and written     Any additional spoken and written language is considered as an advantage                 Our Offer:                 Compensation at par with industry standards?, Corporate Health Insurance & term life insurance.     Financial Stability?, annual reviews?, service awards & reward recognition?, career progression.     Join a dynamic and safety focused team

column2: a)Educational qualification: Degree / Diploma in Electronic Engineering or similar field. b)Experience: Minimum 2 years / 4 years of relevant experience in servicing of electrical & electronic white goods. Experience in handling sensor product will be an added advantage. c)The job calls for fair amount of travelling. Job Description: Periodically (Once a week) speaking to customer to understand complaint if any and to build up relationship. Incumbent will have a list of assigned shed to be serviced. Ensure that the customer warrantee complaint is updated on the service portal of the Service department immediately. Raising warranty workorder and indent to procure material for servicing warrantee claim. Dispatching warranty material to the concerned shed / Railway SSE in time. Visiting loco shed for taking updates with SSE & JE for warranty failures closure by signing of Joint Note. Will be required to have written communication skill in English to be able to generate Joint Note. Maintain record of attending Service. Collected defective part to be dispatched to our works for defect investigation. Will be required to prepare draft reply for complaint letters and submit to reporting officer for scrutiny and release. Submission of defect investigation report to the shed concerned and ensure closure of customer complaint on Railway Portal. Other Traits: d)Computer proficiency in Micro Soft Office. (Using Word, XL) e)Systematic documentation for easy retrieval. f)Proficiency in both Spoken and written English. g)Spoken proficiency in multiple languages will be an added advantage.  h)Age Group: 24 ~ 30 Years.

column2: As a Senior Product Service Engineer, youll play a vital role with our customers. You will be particularly focused on Turbomachinery Rotating Equipment (Steam Turbines, Heavy Duty Gas Turbines and BOP).           As a Senior Product Service Engineer, you will be responsible for:         Providing guidance and recommendation for customer issues resolution for gas turbine and steam turbine, fleet issues, service bulletin implementation, monitoring and diagnostics asset definition, fleet configuration for installed base fleet.     Delivering root cause failure analyses (RCA), defining the containment and recovery strategy.     Discussing the outcome of the analyses with the customers and internal stakeholders; follow up with implementation.     Developing new solutions with or without guidance or based upon precedents in the organization.     Working together with business leadership: specify needs, share info about project approach and outcomes of job done.     Providing technical support to site team during plant outages and follow up the implementation phase, supporting the responsible functions         Working on cross functional teams, as facilitator or specific task subject matter expert.     Actively work with our sales department to identify customer real needs and identify best fit solutions.     Promoting mentoring to less experienced engineers.             Fuel your passion       To be successful in this role you will:       Have a masters or bachelor s degree in engineering with at least 5 years of relevant experience     Have a solid technical foundation and deep knowledge of    Gas turbine, steam turbine and auxiliary systems from a design and/or services perspective.       Have a familiarity with    operability, performance analysis, process applications of turbomachinery.       Have a strong oral and written communication skills in both Italian and English.     Have an effective problem identification and solution skills.     Have a good analytical mind and organizational skills.     Have an ability to manage several projects simultaneously.     Have an availability to support emergencies sometimes out of the normal working hours.     Have an experience in turbomachinery design is added advantage

Have working experience in Instrumentation and Control systems Like Mark VIe OR Mechanical Heavy-duty Gas Turbine OR Centrifugal Compressors.      Have excellent Functional / Technical, Customer Focus, Communication, Interpersonal, and Teamwork Skills      Have prior experience in Installation and/or Maintenance activities of Rotating equipment in the Field at Customer Sites.      Have industry experience and TPS product line training.

column2: Family Description       Customer Services (CS) covers customer service in different areas such as technical support, account support, operations, maintenance, network design / deployment / integration / transformation, and education. Generates revenue and the increase of customer satisfaction through planning, designing, deploying, integrating, optimising, operating, and maintaining phases.       Subfamily Description       Managed Services (MSE) is responsible for keeping the network running and proposing / conducting network upgrades based on business requirements. Covers technical managing and operating of agreed components of IT and telecommunications services provided to end users of Nokia customers, within contracts agreed with those customers.           Impact       Accountable for quality and accuracy of own output. Responsible for contribution to teamwork. Errors may have an impact on function/project/customer. Usually delivers results with a short-term, operational focus and limited impact on others.        Scope & Contribution       Individual Contributor: Participates as an individual contributor to the team, usually with limited professional expertise. Makes decisions affecting own work within set parameters, elevates others. Review priorities with a supervisor. High personal or low collegial interaction. Managerial/Supervisory: May act as Team Leader or Project Leader with some indirect supervisory responsibilities in addition to own work assignments.. Makes decisions that affect own work.        Innovation       Semi-routine tasks of moderate complexity require some discretion and judgment. Carries out tasks/activities according to assignment and set guidelines. A moderate degree of supervision and coaching is needed. Demonstrates initiative and adaptability to changing business environments.        Communication       Explains facts, practices, policies, etc to external and internal parties. Takes actions that respect to the needs and contributions of others and reaches agreement through flexibility and compromise. Manages situations where there is a common desire to reach solution within a team. Sometimes requires the ability to influence others outside of own job area on policies, practices, and procedures. column2: The Shift Engineer is responsible for overseeing the efficient operation and maintenance of our Biogas Production Plant during their assigned shift. This role plays a critical part in ensuring the continuous and safe production of biogas to meet production targets and quality standards. The Shift Engineer will lead a team of technicians and operators and coordinate activities to maximize plant uptime and performance.       Key Responsibilities:       - Monitor Plant Operations: Continuously monitor the operation of the Biogas Production Plant during the assigned shift to ensure safety, efficiency, and compliance with operating procedures.     - Troubleshooting: Identify and troubleshoot equipment malfunctions and operational issues promptly, taking corrective action as needed to minimize downtime.     - Team Leadership: Supervise and lead a team of technicians and operators during the shift, ensuring that tasks are assigned and completed efficiently.     - Routine Maintenance: Oversee routine maintenance activities, including equipment inspections, lubrication, and minor repairs, to ensure optimal plant performance.     - Safety Compliance: Enforce safety protocols and procedures to maintain a safe working environment for all plant personnel. Conduct safety training as necessary.     - Quality Control: Monitor and maintain the quality of the biogas produced, making necessary adjustments to maintain product specifications.     - Documentation: Maintain accurate records of plant operations, maintenance activities, and any incidents that occur during the shift.     - Emergency Response: Be prepared to respond to emergencies or unexpected operational issues, coordinating with the appropriate personnel and authorities as needed.     - Communication: Provide regular shift reports to Plant Manager and collaborate with other shifts to ensure a smooth transition of operations.     - Energy Efficiency: Identify opportunities for energy efficiency improvements and propose solutions to reduce energy consumption.       Qualifications:       - Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or a related field preferred. High school diploma or equivalent required.     - Proven experience in the operation and maintenance of biogas production plants or similar industrial facilities.     - Strong knowledge of biogas production processes, equipment, and safety protocols.     - Ability to lead a team effectively and make quick, informed decisions during emergencies.     - Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.     - Good communication and interpersonal skills.     - Willingness to work in a shift-based schedule, including nights and weekends.     - Knowledge of environmental regulations related to biogas production is a plus.
column11: Plant operations, Interpersonal skills, Quality standards, Compliance, Safety training, Chemical engineering, Manager Quality Control, Troubleshooting, Operations, Mechanical engineering

column2: As a TIM Engineer, you likely work for TIM (Telecom Italia Mobile), one of the largest telecommunications companies in Italy     TIM offers a wide range of services, including mobile and fixed-line telephony, internet, and digital television     As a TIM Engineer, your responsibilities may vary depending on your specific role within the company       However, some common tasks and areas of expertise for TIM Engineers include:       Network Planning and Design: You might be involved in the planning and design of telecommunication networks, both for mobile and fixed-line services     This could include determining the optimal network architecture, selecting equipment and technologies, and optimizing network performance and capacity     Network Implementation and Optimization: Once the network design is finalized, you may be responsible for implementing the network infrastructure, including installing and configuring equipment, testing connectivity, and optimizing network performance     This could involve collaborating with cross-functional teams, such as field technicians and network operations center (NOC) personnel     Troubleshooting and Maintenance: As a TIM Engineer, you may be involved in diagnosing and resolving network issues, both proactively and reactively     This could include troubleshooting network outages, analyzing performance metrics, and implementing corrective measures to ensure the network operates efficiently     Network Security: In today's digital landscape, network security is crucial     You may be responsible for implementing and maintaining security measures to protect the network infrastructure from cyber threats     This could involve configuring firewalls, implementing encryption protocols, and monitoring network traffic for potential security breaches     Research and Development: TIM Engineers may also contribute to research and development efforts within the company     This could involve exploring new technologies, evaluating their potential applications, and conducting feasibility studies to enhance the company's network infrastructure and services     Collaboration and Documentation: Effective collaboration and documentation are vital in any engineering role     You may collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as software developers, project managers, and customer support, to ensure smooth operations and service delivery     Additionally, documenting network configurations, troubleshooting procedures, and best practices is essential for knowledge sharing and maintaining an organized network infrastructure
column11: Telecom, Network design, Network infrastructure, Network operations, Network troubleshooting, Network security, Telecommunication, Customer support, Network planning, network architecture

column2: Main activity and purpose of the position "   Service Engineer   " is to provide technical service support to Liebherr customers and machines.                 ?           Role and Responsibilities:                 Diagnose, adjust, repair or overhaul equipment of Liebherr EMT division such as Wheeled Loaders, Excavators, Dozers etc             Apply electrical, electronically, hydraulically and mechanical theory and related knowledge to test and modify operational electrical machinery and electrical control, electronically control equipment and circuitry, hydraulically circuits and components, mechanical equipment. Test mechanical products and equipment after repair or modification to ensure proper performance and compliance with manufacturer s specifications. Oversees the maintenance of quality standards through visual and mechanical inspection methods.             Demonstrate working knowledge of Machine diagnostic Software used on handled machines.             Complete jobs independently with as little assistance from others as possible.             Assist customers with troubleshooting, part and machine related questions when needed.             While assisting customers or during visits to machines inform and ensure customer and their operation and maintenance staff follows the correct maintenance practice. Wherever needed record the incorrect processes and instruct customer to follow the correct practices.             Maintains a minimum set of tools and Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) required for job performance.             Cares and maintains company tools, machines and equipment.             Maintains a positive attitude and role model for the other employees to follow.             Maintains company service literature, and maintains a high awareness of technical changes.             Trains and/or mentors others in department.             Complete assigned paperwork as to procedures. As a minimum time sheet, work report, expense report in the latest available version. Fill out all forms properly including customer signature where applicable.             Promotes a safe work environment by following on site safety rules and ensuring the group and self-follow established safety procedures.             Oversees the handling and disposing of hazardous wastes, such as toner, oil, antifreeze, transmission fluid, auto parts cleaner and similar material.             Refuses to carry out unsafe tasks in conflict with Liebherr procedures or technical rules.             Follows the Liebherr code of conduct.             Apart from above carries out any other responsibility assigned by the management from time to time. column2: Job Description The purpose of this Job role is to ensure the effective installation, maintenance, and repair of our mechanical equipment and machinery at client sites. Your role is crucial in providing exemplary technical support to our customers, ensuring optimal performance and longevity of our products. You will be responsible for diagnosing equipment faults, performing repairs, conducting preventive maintenance, and providing technical guidance to clients and internal teams. By delivering high-quality service and fostering positive customer relationships, you will play a key role in enhancing customer satisfaction, driving repeat business, and maintaining our company's reputation for excellence in mechanical engineering solutions.  "Service Beyond Expectations, Solutions Beyond Borders."    Responsibility  Efficiently install and commission high-pressure triplex pumps and associated machinery  Visit client sites, diagnose and repair faults in equipment to minimize downtime and ensure continuous operation  Ensure that service requests are handled promptly and efficiently to meet agreed-upon timelines. Communicate with customers regarding service timelines, updates, and convince proactively for any potential delays.  Provide proactive communication and manage expectations effectively to ensure customer satisfaction.  Collaborate with internal departments such as operations, logistics, and technical teams to ensure smooth execution of service delivery.  Coordinate resources and activities to optimize service efficiency and minimize turnaround time.  Ensure all service activities are conducted in compliance with safety regulations and company standards.  Provide comprehensive training to customers on the proper usage and maintenance of our products.  Work closely with the engineering team to resolve complex technical issues and improve product functionality.  Work with cross-functional teams to resolve challenges and ensure seamless execution.  Provide feedback to the design team based on field experience to enhance the reliability and performance of our products.  Maintain detailed records of service activities, repairs, and customer interactions for management and audit purposes.  Ensure accuracy and completeness of documentation to facilitate efficient tracking and analysis Conduct regular evaluations and assessments to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as necessary.  Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to service delivery timeliness and customer satisfaction.    Area of Knowledge & Expertise Minimum 1 to 3 years of experience in service roles, preferably in the machinery/ industrial equipment industry.  15-20 days traveling abilities in various climates. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and within team.  Problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities. Basket of Opportunities Chance to work with an Indian leader manufacturer of high-quality industrial high-pressure reciprocating plunger pumps with a global presence.  Get a chance to learn Oracle ERP Encourages Out of the Box Ideas  Meritocracy: You Perform You Move Up in the Ladder!! Exciting Chance to Transform a Developing Organization into a Developed Organization  Peaceful and Aesthetic workplace to improve productivity  Systematic Learning Environment to improve skill & knowledge  Get Access to a great corporate  library , which will elevate your  domain learning

Minimum   Requirements 2 to 5 years of service engineer.   PREFERENCE  : Experience in servicing of products related to entrance control products & solutions i.e. Boom Barriers, Tripods, Turnstiles, Flap Barriers, Gate / Door Operators, Bollards, Road Blockers, Parking Management Solutions, RFID, etc. -Verifiable history of accountability, perseverance and goal achievement. -The curiosity of a life-long learner and the demonstrated commitment of a leader. -The ability to initiate and support complex independent and team-servicing initiatives. Strong entrepreneurial spirit and a value-centric, consultative service and maintenance process. Strong task-orientation and problem-solving skills that allow you to operate as an autonomous team member. Disciplined use of CRM. Knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
