column2: As a Managed Operational Services (MOS) Engineer, youll be responsible for providing remote support and maintenance for NICE platforms at customer sites. Your primary focus will be on managing NICE-related issues and outages promptly, enhancing the clients ability to maintain their NICE system. Additionally, youll assist with NICE projects, installations, and change management to support the customers environment and infrastructure as needed.         How will you make an impact?          Utilize your knowledge of NICE solutions, particularly Engage/NTR, to support client infrastructure globally.     Create and maintain records of cases, performing remediation based on severity.     Provide L1/L2/L3 support for NICE products, coordinating efforts with suppliers and other representatives as required.     Assist client administrators with configuration, administration, and user management in the NICE system.     Document and maintain NICE system specifications (Site Documentation) across all sites.     Conduct proactive Health Checks on a regular basis.     Perform Move/Add/Change (MAC) jobs as needed.     Manage customer relationships and expectations, effectively communicating and resolving technical issues.     Manage time efficiently, providing regular updates to both customers and management.     Participate in training classes and special projects as required.     Undertake additional roles and responsibilities as assigned.         Have you got what it takes?          Minimum 7+ years of proven experience in:     Working with voice and data networks in design, implementation, or project management capacities.     Microsoft operating systems, networking, SQL, security, and VoIP technology.     Telephony experience and certifications (TDM, VoIP, CTI) are advantageous.     Familiarity with common PBX, switch, and ACD vendors such as Avaya, Nortel, Aspect, Siemens, and Cisco is beneficial.     Experience with CTI vendors and technologies (Avaya Map-D, Nortel Symposium, Aspect Prospect, etc.) is advantageous.     HP, MCSE, MCP certifications are advantageous.     Certification on all NICE Systems solutions is advantageous.     Experience working in medium or large teams with a strong team player mindset.     High customer service orientation, representing NICE effectively in verbal and written communications.         You will have an advantage if you also have:         NICE Engage Certification.     CCNA and MCSE certifications.     AWS, Azure, HP, Dell, VMWare, and Citrix certifications are advantageous.
column11: VMware, Networking, Project management, Flex, VOIP, microsoft, CCNA, MCSE, cisco, SQL

SSQS evaluations would be taken on STEP (Service Training Evaluation Portal)                      SSQS evaluation will be in to two stages as SSQS Bronze and SSQS Silver.                      Web based link for theory examination thru iPad available at RTC s            Phase 1               Candidates appear for theory exam thru paper-based method, checking of same needs time and scores entered manually in score sheet by evaluators.                      Conduct the theory exam for all the participants.                      Attendance to be marked in STEP before initiating theory test                      Based out of Theory exam eligible candidates are selected for practical exam. Practical evaluation will be conducted thru Service Training Evaluation Portal (STEP).                      Preparation of Vehicle for practical examination.                      Preparation of tools and Equipment for practical.                      For each practical apply the necessary settings in the vehicle kept for examination.                      For each participant evaluator must Prepare the tools and vehicle for practical examination.                      If its silver certification then the evaluator must prepare everything to conduct two practical exams.                      After completing practical exam evaluator must prepare result.                      Share the report/results to client on the same day and update all the report to the online portal.                      After sharing report evaluator must download the results for each candidate and take print out then attach the sheets with individual candidate check sheet.                      Maintain the report hard copy in RTC (Regional Training Centre). column2: The function of the Field Engineer is to act as the mobile field service engineer on assigned open tickets and work in collaboration with senior engineering staff members, Response Center, and logistics to resolve customer affecting technical issues in a timely fashion in order to maintain maximum customer satisfaction second to none.     The Field Engineer installs, troubleshoots and maintains an extensive variety of products and equipment. Trains employees, identifies, analyzes, and repairs product failures, orders and replaces parts as needed. Determines and recommends which products or services best fit the customers needs. Requires a bachelor s degree or equivalent certifications in area of specialty and 4-6 years of experience in the field or in a related area.     Familiar with a variety of the field s concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. May lead and direct the work of others. A wide degree of creativity, leadership, and latitude is expected. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department.       Field Engineer responsibilities are:         Has a thorough understanding of and practices techniques to prevent ESD damage to components.         Perform remedial repair activities on customer site.         Perform hardware installations.         Perform assignments as directed by Response Center Technicians or senior technical staff.         Require infrequent backline support while performing remedial activities on-site.         Recognize situations requiring a service call Escalation and follows proper Escalation Procedures.         Provide the support required to close service events promptly, within the SLA and to the satisfaction of the customer ( fix the customer ).         Provides timely, accurate and unambiguous updates to the ticketing system.         As needed, communicates frequently with customers and other TERiX personnel.         Validating actual problem and validating correct parts to be used for service.         Effective debrief and reporting of service call for future enhancements.         Travel to and from customer locations, documenting work activity and maintaining administrative paperwork.         Software training including, but not limited to, servers, storage and networking equipment.         Hardware training including, but not limited to servers, storage and networking equipment.         Test various parts used for service.         Train other engineers.         Ability to work with and enhance the team (synergy) concept.         Follow company guidelines for SLA (Service Level Agreement) for responding to customer calls.         Follow Company Procedure for Parts Supply for Customer Service.         Follow appropriate procedures, either Software or Hardware, to resolve the issue.         Communicate issue and problem resolution notes back to Response Center.         Work within established guidelines and procedures.         Perform any other duties assigned by your manager       Qualification:       Strong Communication Skills.         Strong Customer Facing Skills.         Strong Troubleshooting Skills and technical aptitude.         Minimum directly related experience of 4 years.         Valid Driver s License, reliable vehicle, current auto insurance policy, with a Good Driving Record.         Technical Bachelor s Degree or Equivalent Technical Certifications.

column2: Performs repair, calibration, and modification of the wide variety of complex precision measurement equipment utilized by GOK agencies       This discipline includes the following measurement areas: impedance, attenuation, directivity, power, frequency (above 500 MHz), phase, pulse code modulation, VSWR, noise, sensitivity and gain     It encompasses the repair, calibration, or modification of items such as waveguide/coaxial frequency meters, RF signal generators, spectrum analyzers, TACAN test sets, waveguide and coaxial directional couplers, RF power meters, VSWR indicators, slotted lines and other complex RF/microwave equipment     Typically, this knowledge would have been gained by the technician successfully completing a one-year certificate program in electronic technology from an accredited school or equivalent US military training program     It is anticipated that Engineering Technicians will be assigned as these job descriptions state and other related specific tasking details and priorities will be determined and set by the Commander, KAFMB and communicated to the Contractor lead     Associate s degree and three (3) years of work experience operating, maintaining, troubleshooting, repairing, calibrating RF/Microwave electronic precision measurement equipment and calibration laboratory reference standards     Requires working knowledge of the basic concepts of electronics and science; including; basic electricity, electronics, circuit theory, digital logic, algebra, and physic

Boring machines & cylindrical Grinding Machines  &  Gear cutting machines. Pre inspection of Foundation , understanding foundation drawings of the machine is a must .
